alert.note: Alert for Butler; Harvey (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 06 at 1:18AM CST until January 06 at 8:00AM CST by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero. * WHERE...Harvey and Butler Counties. * WHEN...For Winter Weather Advisory, until 8 am this morning. For Wind Chill Advisory until 11 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the early morning commute. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel on the Kansas turnpike and I-135 will be affected by the snow, blowing snow and occasional strong cross- winds, making travel difficult and hazardous tonight.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
